title: Please come to get the real meaning of the "Bill withdrawal"

replies.msg:
Please copy and share

Don't be fooled by Carrie Lam!

TL;DR: It isn’t fucking over; Carrie Lam’s playing with words. The bill has NOT been withdrawn!

Today, the leader of Hong Kong, Carrie Lam, proposed a motion of the withdrawal of the extradition bill. This, however, does not signify the victory of our battle.

In the press release, the leader blatantly dismissed the other four demands of two millions protestors, including the establishment of an independent commission of inquiry and universal suffrage. Also, the bill is still NOT FORMALLY withdrawn as the retraction is a mere motion that can be vetoed by the pro-Beijing camp of the legislative body. While the legislative council will only continue the meeting or session in early October to deal with any agenda/proposal of bills. Carrie Lam is playing trick to get more time to first of all try to relieve the social atmosphere by saying such non-legally binding words, at the same time keep abusively arresting protesters and suppressing any dissenting voices. Until October if the suppression is effective, she will continue the bill to second and then third reading quickly to pass it in the legislative council. We, Hongkongers, know her too well, this is her habit.
Our demands are still not met.

The fugitive bill saga reveals the abuse of power of the police and the tightening grip of freedom from Beijing. Since June, we have seen the police force harming civilians in train stations; Beijing threatening to mobilise the garrison. To Hongkongers, the protest is now an act of resistance against police brutality and the narrowing freedom taken away by China. We are fighting for our future.

In such difficult time, we would love to ask for your support. Your understanding of our situation is important to pressurise the government.

We shall never surrender. Please support us.
Please anybody can add anything to let the crowds know clear what is the real purpose of the tricky Carrie Lam

replies.msg:
Please copy and share

Don't be fooled by Carrie Lam!

TL;DR: It isn’t fucking over; Carrie Lam’s playing with words. The bill has NOT been withdrawn!

Today, the leader of Hong Kong, Carrie Lam, proposed a motion of the withdrawal of the extradition bill. This, however, does not signify the victory of our battle.

In the press release, the leader blatantly dismissed the other four demands of two millions protestors, including the establishment of an independent commission of inquiry and universal suffrage. Also, the bill is still NOT FORMALLY withdrawn as the retraction is a mere motion that can be vetoed by the pro-Beijing camp of the legislative body, while the legislative council will only continue the meeting or session in early October to deal with any agenda/proposal of bills. She can still not keep her promise to continue the bill to second and then third reading quickly to pass it in the legislative council. We, Hongkongers, know her too well, this is her personality.

One of the most important effects that she may hope to achieve, is to stop any helping hands to us from the world outside Hong Kong and China, as one may believes what she promises in the press release today and really think that we win the battle. We never trust any word from her but only practice action from the government.

Our demands are still not met.

The fugitive bill saga reveals the abuse of power of the police and the tightening grip of freedom from Beijing. Since June, we have seen the police force harming civilians in train stations; Beijing threatening to mobilise the garrison. To Hongkongers, the protest is now an act of resistance against police brutality and the narrowing freedom taken away by China. We are fighting for our future.

In such difficult time, we would love to ask for your support. Your understanding of our situation is important to pressurise the government.

We shall never surrender. Please support us.
